meaning_str.bing:
n. 边缘；边沿；刀刃；利刃
v. 渐渐移动；给…加边；略为增加（或减少）
网络. 棱；优势；艾吉

渐渐移动；给…加边；略为增加（或减少）

边缘；边界；边沿；边线；前沿；刀刃；刃口；利刃；锋利度；尖锐性；（微弱的）优势；微妙差别；（情绪的）紧张；（竞争的）激烈；尖刻的声调
使锋利；使尖锐；使徐徐移动；逐渐移动；慢慢前进；缓缓行进；略为增加（或减少）；（滑雪时）侧身滑行；给…加边；（在比赛中）取得微弱优势

1.en: and although she was a little afraid at first, she soon got warmed up and sat on the edge of the mantelpiece and began to talk.
1.cn: 起先，她有点儿害怕，很快就暖和起来，卧到壁炉台沿上，开始讲了起来。

2.en: It was already dark by the time they got to the edge of the wood that surrounded their property.
2.cn: 他们到达围着他们房屋的树林时天已经黑了。

3.en: One idea was that it reached out to "the edge of the world. " Sailors were afraid that they might sail right off the earth.
3.cn: 一种想法是大西洋远抵“世界的边缘”，海员们担心他们会一直航行到地球边上掉落下去。

0.en: But when no one was looking, she'd go near the cliff, for the closer she came to the edge, the more she could hear, the more she could see, the more she could feel.
0.cn: 但她却背着家人来到了悬崖边，她越走近悬崖边，听到的越多，看到的越多，感受到的越多。

1.en: Here's a woman who describes her vows as a suicide flirting with a bridge's edge. And a man who wears his wedding ring as a badge of shame, for the debutante deserved more.
1.cn: 这个女人将自己的婚誓比作在桥边犹豫自杀的徘徊，和一个将婚戒当作羞耻徽章的男人，因为他觉得配不上这位名媛。

2.en: He tricked me. He flew over there, and I went after him and slipped off the edge of the trail. I was hanging on by a tree branch. I was hanging by my fingertips.
2.cn: 它使诈了，它又飞走了，然后我再追上去，但是我滑倒了，摔下了小路边，说时迟那时快，我抓住了一个树枝，我单靠着手指尖在那吊着。

3.en: Well, this is what happens when people live on the edge.
3.cn: 当人们活在危机边缘的时候，就是会发生这种事。

4.en: The force field. lt's a dome. We're at the edge of the arena.
4.cn: 电磁力场是个拱顶，我们在竞技场的边缘。

5.en: It's actually all to do with something that coats the edge of the leaf.
5.cn: 实际上这和叶片边缘表层有关。

6.en: What you mean? We almost lost the arrow. It was on the edge of the building.
6.cn: 什么意思？我们差点失去那枝箭，它射在大楼边缘。

7.en: Finally she stood at the very edge. She saw a light. She leaned out to touch it and she slipped.
7.cn: 终于她站在了悬崖边缘, 她看到了亮光, 她伸出手去触摸, 可是滑了一下。

8.en: I guess I would say curious. I remember the first time I walked up on the edge of the Grand Canyon.
8.cn: 我想应该是好奇。我记得我第一次走在科罗拉多大峡谷边缘的情景。

9.en: Where? Near Barbosa Lake. He was standing on the edge of a ravine. What did Robert tell you when you got there?
9.cn: 在哪？在巴博萨湖附近。他站在峡谷边上。你到之后罗伯特跟你说了什么？

10.en: You park on the edge of the Neutral Zone, you lock onto Harrison's position, you fire, you kill him and you haul ass.
10.cn: 你把飞船停在中立区边缘，然后锁定哈里森的位置，开火，杀了他就把飞船开回来。

11.en: Here's what matters. You're on the edge of a cliff. Today is the cliff. Tomorrow, there is nothing underneath your feet.
11.cn: 接下来说的才是重要的，你正处在悬崖边缘，今天就相当于悬崖，明天你的脚下将空无一物。

12.en: How come every time we're on the edge of this reef, one of us is trying to leave? For once, can't we just enjoy the view?
12.cn: 为何每次我们到这珊瑚礁边缘，就有人想离开。我们就不能好好欣赏风景吗？

13.en: Let's start by identifying the parts of our flag. This edge is the hoist, and it's used to... Excuse me, sorry, excuse me.
13.cn: 那我们先开始认识旗帜的结构，这边是吊孔，用来……抱歉，借过一下。

14.en: No, what if it was a precursor movement along the leading edge of the plate boundary fault from Los Angeles all the way up to San Francisco?
14.cn: 不，如果这是板块运动的开始，而板块的边界从洛杉矶一直延续到旧金山。

15.en: Well, that's why you're here, isn't it? To assist with our repairs? Why else would the head of Starfleet personally come to the edge of the Neutral Zone?
15.cn: 我想这就是您来这里的原因，没错吧? 来帮助我们维修？不然为什么联盟的高官会亲自来到中立区的边缘地带?

16.en: Enclosed in a bubble made of the same material as the cell membrane, the golgi apparatus also gives the antibody directions, telling it how to get to the edge of the cell.
16.cn: 包在一个由细胞膜物质组成的泡泡里，高基式体也会给抗体指示，告诉它怎么去细胞的边缘。

17.en: And they say you've lost your edge.

18.en: It gives it that extra edge. You've done us proud.
18.cn: 别有一番风味，我们为你骄傲。

19.en: Yeah, I looked at your blog. It's a little too cutesy for me. I need someone with edge. I have edge.
19.cn: 是，没错，但我查看了你的博客，对我来说有点太故意卖萌了，我需要一个犀利的人。我很犀利啊。
